articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: A boy who lived in the same Douglas County foster home where three other former residents were allegedly abused as children has filed a lawsuit against the state, claiming he too was abused while living there.
articles.title: Another lawsuit alleges foster home abuse

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: In July, Gov. Tina Kotek signed Executive Order No. 25-09, a personal electronic device policy for school districts. The policy said due to negative impacts on mental health and many other reasons, all Oregon school districts are required to have…
articles.title: Douglas County schools give mostly positive feedback on cell phone ban

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: A press release from the Oregon Department of Forestry (ODF) said that Oregon is now home to a new invasive, destructive tiny beetle. The Mediterranean oak borer (MOB) has been found in multiple places in northern Oregon.
articles.title: What Douglas County should know about the Mediterranean oak borer

articles.author: NATHAN A. MILLER The News-Review
articles.description: The Douglas County Courthouse will be illuminated in green throughout November to honor veterans and their families.
articles.title: Douglas County Courthouse glows green to honor veterans

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
The shuttering of Rogue Ales & Spirits has a distinct and severe impact on the local tourism economy of Newport, Oregon, moving beyond just job losses to affect the city’s identity as a destination. 1. Loss of a Major Anchor Attraction Rogue Ales’ flagship brewery and public house on the Newport Bayfront was far more…
The post The Economic Ripple: Tourism Impact of Rogue Ales’ Closure on Newport, Oregon appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: The Economic Ripple: Tourism Impact of Rogue Ales’ Closure on Newport, Oregon

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
11/14/2025 NEWPORT, OR – The abrupt closure of Rogue Ales & Spirits, a 37-year veteran and nationally recognized brand, serves as a sharp indicator of the financial rationalization currently sweeping the U.S. craft beer sector. The sudden shutdown of the company’s main Newport brewery and all associated public houses highlights the vulnerability of regional brewers…
The post Case Study: Rogue Ales Closure Signals Crisis in Mid-Tier Craft Brewing appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Case Study: Rogue Ales Closure Signals Crisis in Mid-Tier Craft Brewing

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
Nov 14, 2025 NEWPORT, OR — In a stunning and sudden move that sent shockwaves through the craft beer community, Rogue Ales & Spirits has ceased all operations, effective immediately. The closure, which included the iconic main brewery and public house in Newport, as well as all other pubs across Oregon, reportedly happened without any…
The post End of an Era: Rogue Ales Abruptly Closes All Operations, Citing Financial Crisis appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: End of an Era: Rogue Ales Abruptly Closes All Operations, Citing Financial Crisis

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
Mercy Flights will launch a groundbreaking pilot program thanks to a generous grant of $350,000 fromthe Ashland Community Health Foundation (ACHF). The 12-month initiative will bring emergencymedical care directly into the home of seniors and veterans across Jackson County while reducingunnecessary emergency department visits. Mercy Flights is expanding its community-based care programs, including Alternative Destinations…
The post Mercy Flights and Ashland Community Health Foundation Announce $350,000 Grant appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Mercy Flights and Ashland Community Health Foundation Announce $350,000 Grant

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Two Eugene residents were arrested after police seized 73 pounds of methamphetamine during a traffic stop on I-5 near Cottage Grove. Investigators say the pair had been transporting drugs from California to Eugene. Additional evidence was found during searches of their homes.
articles.title: Two Eugene Residents Arrested After 73 Pounds of Meth Seized on I-5

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: November 14, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Umpqua Valley Tennis Center is entering the final phase of its outdoor renovation, with the upgraded courts taking shape and reopening expected in December. Staff say the project is coming together quickly and they’re excited to welcome the community back soon.
articles.title: Umpqua Valley Tennis Center Nears Completion of Outdoor Court Renovation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Police responded to Sutherlin High School on Nov. 12 after reports that a student brought a knife to campus. Staff had already detained the student and secured the weapon. The student was arrested and faces charges including attempted assault, menacing, stalking, and unlawful weapon use.
articles.title: Student Arrested After Knife Incident at Sutherlin High School

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: November 13, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: After 238 years, the U.S. Mint has retired the penny. Officials cite rising production costs as retailers and consumers now face rounding challenges and legal questions over exact change. Existing pennies will remain legal tender as the nation adjusts to life without its oldest coin.
articles.title: Farewell to the Penny: America’s 238-Year-Old Coin Reaches Its End

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Fire crews quickly knocked down a blaze that damaged a manufactured home off Brosi Orchard Road in Winston Tuesday evening. All occupants and their dog escaped safely. No injuries were reported, but the cause of the fire remains undetermined due to extensive damage.
articles.title: Fire Damages Manufactured Home on Brosi Orchard Road in Winston

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: November 12, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Hundreds to even thousands gathered downtown for Roseburg’s 70th Annual Veterans Day Parade, featuring veterans groups, bands, scouts, fire departments, and community organizations honoring local service members and celebrating seven decades of tradition.
articles.title: Hundreds Line Streets for Roseburg’s 70th Annual Veterans Day Parade

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Yoncalla City Council voted unanimously to end its contract with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office, citing higher costs and limited funds. The agreement for patrol and ordinance enforcement will officially end December 31, 2025.
articles.title: Rising Costs Lead Yoncalla to Drop Sheriff’s Office Contract

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: More than 35 Winston Middle School students walked out Monday afternoon, protesting bullying and demanding accountability. Parents and students say the demonstration highlights ongoing safety concerns and a need for stronger anti-bullying action.
articles.title: Winston Middle School Students Walk Out to Protest Bullying, Call for Safer Schools
